conclusion: Analyze forces on each block using Newton's second law.
Block A has a horizontal pulling force F and friction force f_AB from block B.
Block B has friction force f_AB from block A, spring force F_s from block C, and friction force f_BC from block C.
Block C has spring force F_s from block B, friction force f_BC from block B, and friction force f_CD from block D.
Block D has friction force f_CD from block C.
Apply Newton's second law to block A: F - f_AB = ma.
Apply Newton's second law to block B: f_AB - F_s - f_BC = ma.
Apply Newton's second law to block C: F_s - f_BC - f_CD = ma.
Apply Newton's second law to block D: f_CD = ma.
Solve for acceleration a: F = 4ma, so a = F/4m.
Determine static friction on block D: f_CD = ma = F/4.
